Answer the following question based on the information in the given passage. Passage: The first serious attempt at dedicated television news broadcasts in the United States was by CBS.  Upon becoming commercial station WCBW (now WCBS-TV) in 1941, the pioneer New York CBS television station broadcast two daily news programs, at 2:30 and 7:30p.m. weekdays, anchored by Richard Hubbell. Most of the newscasts featured Hubbell reading a script with only occasional cutaways to a map or still photograph. Question: What was the first TV news station in the US? Answer:

summary: The first serious attempt at dedicated television news broadcasts in the United States was by CBS.  Upon becoming commercial station WCBW (now WCBS-TV) in 1941, the pioneer New York CBS television station broadcast two daily news programs, at 2:30 and 7:30p.m. weekdays, anchored by Richard Hubbell. Most of the newscasts featured Hubbell reading a script with only occasional cutaways to a map or still photograph.
question: What was the first TV news station in the US?
label: CBS
